Clean and prepare Dedoose excerpt data

Source: R/clean_data.R
clean_data.Rd

This function takes excerpt data exported from Dedoose (either as a data frame or as a file path to an Excel file) and prepares it for analysis by:

  • Standardizing variable names to lowercase

  • Renaming "excerpt copy" to "excerpt"

  • Dropping columns ending with "range" or "weight"

  • Converting code columns (prefixed with "code: ") to logical variables

  • Renaming code columns to remove prefixes/suffixes

  • Filtering excerpts to retain only the coder with the highest preference

  • Adding variable labels for interpretability

Usage

clean_data(excerpts, preferred_coders)

Arguments

excerpts

A data frame of excerpts or a file path (character string) to an Excel file exported from Dedoose.

preferred_coders

A character vector giving the coders in order of preference. Excerpts will be filtered so that, for each media title, only excerpts from the highest-ranked coder are retained.

Value

A cleaned data.frame containing excerpts and associated variables.

Details

In addition to returning a cleaned data frame, the function creates a codebook object in the global environment that contains metadata on all variables in the dataset, including variable names, labels, and types.

The function also creates a codebook object in the global environment with three columns:

  • variable: the variable name

  • label: the variable label (if assigned, otherwise the name)

  • type: the storage type/class of the variable

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Example usage
excerpts <- readxl::read_xlsx("inst/raw_data/test_data_manipulated.xlsx")
preferred_coders <- c("s", "r", "l", "a")
cleaned <- clean_data(excerpts, preferred_coders)

# View codebook
head(codebook)
} # }
